newsitem.title: GHANA: Ghana names new chief executive of Cocoa Board.
newsitem.headline: Ghana names new chief executive of Cocoa Board.

text.p: Ghana's President Jerry Rawlings has named an executive from the buying subsidiary of the Ghana Cocoa Board (COCOBOD) as COCOBOD's new chief executive, an official statement said.
John Henry Newman takes over from Flight-Lieutenant Joe Atiemo, who had been acting chief executive of the state marketing board since September 1993.
Rawlings named traditional chief Jacob Somiah Odeneho Ababio II as chairman of the COCOBOD's newly reconstituted Board of Directors, the statement said.
It added that the Finance Ministry would take charge of cocoa industry affairs from the president's office.
Atiemo was expected to regain his post of deputy chief executive of operations, a COCOBOD official told Reuters.
COCOBOD spokesman Chris Awuah would not say why Rawlings had ordered the reshuffle.
Newman, 50, had been deputy managing director in charge of operations at the Produce Buying Company, a COCOBOD subsidiary.
Somiah is currently president of the Western Regional House of Chiefs, a forum of traditional leaders.
